messages: 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:12): Hey all, what do you think of this? http://pastie.org/1592179 a list of standard abbreviated class names to be used in your projects? There's a community editable version @ http://oksoclap.com/ftwclassnames
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (18:19): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: I think it's really in line with how I do things.  Semantic-esque naming, "inherited" naming, etc

bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (18:20): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: Ranking abbreviations are really not, however.  Calling something a "child" is almost as bad as .container, which isn't my cup-o-joe
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:21): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: agreed.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:30): I have improved the documentation under "Abbreviation Combinations and Ordering"
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:46): question, I have an error I want displayed saying 'Please select another video'
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:46): what tag should I wrap around with
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:46): it's just plain text with a red background
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (18:48): not sure it matters
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:49): just want to know the proper semantics, all will do the job
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (18:50): personally, i'd probably go with a paragraph
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:53): if it has meaning, put it in something meaningful.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:53): think of divs as more structural.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:53): and accept that you will, most likely, have to offset certain styles on a p
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:53): like the margin.

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (18:54): that's if you want to be squeaky clean IMHO, but remember that if the text isn't readable by a spider, it won't make much difference to SEO.  however, it could be useful to screen readers, I suppose.
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:56): thanks guys
05500b78fe7440a578ac1d6c7d45c3e0 (18:56): i'll go for the P then

5a6087e67149fdbac9e59a673309de76 (21:10): jamund: hello
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:11): Anyone keeping up with the ad tracking nonsense?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:12): Seems like a load of FUD to me
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:12): Tracking ads are innocuous, and a pretty big deal for marketers
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:13): Browser vendors are pushing it to capitalize on fear, 11-o'clock-news-style
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:15): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8. I agree completely.
d489ff1b992e28e05d7edc148195f283 (21:15): It's not just with browser vendors or on the web, but I've seen fear and FUD everywhere on that topic.
f77136d30ffa1db0c8ac0bb00e28b29c (21:16): I'd actually PREFER they track me and serve some useful ads (or less annoying ones) than just blindly send me random ads about stuff I'll never buy.
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:16): I'm responding mostly to this (well-balanced) article: http://lifehacker.com/#!5767080/what-do-not-track-is-and-why-its-important
fb23a69ae45317b123262e6ea8db6369 (21:17): Searching the best/simplest/cleanest way to have scrollable tbody with webkit, anybody ?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:17): I think some people are realistic about it, but if it becomes a selling-point for a browser, Joe Dude might get the wrong idea

3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:25): 19685048ab49226517b9e214a6e971f6: motorolla droid seems to be 480 x 854 pixels
24a51cd4129fd476eb5f2174c2daa360 (21:25): I'll put a fiddle
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:25): kewl
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:25): 19685048ab49226517b9e214a6e971f6: in short, no standard in resolution
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:25): Resolution is irrelevant in mobile, really
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:26): It's all about columns
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:26): how many columns and how wide
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:26): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: Things don't become difficult to manage from a user-end perspective until you introduce h-scroll
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:27): well resolution will tell you when horizontal scroll is required
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:27): clearly you can do multiple column on 1024px easier than on a 320px
24a51cd4129fd476eb5f2174c2daa360 (21:28): http://jsfiddle.net/FrsMz/ why is it not that easy ?
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:28): i even written jquery mobile 960 exactly for this
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:28): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: It's not about resolution, it's about width
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:28): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: In inches/cm
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:28): http://jeromeetienne.github.com/jquery-mobile-960/
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:28): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: ah ok. i agree
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:29): Lower than ~6in in width (just an estimate), and you've got yourself a smartphone or smartphone-esque design challenge
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:33): At which point, you should reduce to one column for everything
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:33): One way to think about things: smartphone = singlecolumn, all others = multicolumn
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:34): I could imagine some cool designs though with superthin scrolling columns on smartphones, however...
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:34): Like the iOS date/time pickers
